00051 #ifndef SYMBOL_H
00052 #define SYMBOL_H
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 extern "C" {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #include <stdio.h>
00059 
00060 #include "host.h"
00061 #include "misc.h"
00062 #include "machine.h"
00063 
00064 enum sym_seg_t {
00065   ss_data,                      /* data segment symbol */
00066   ss_text,                      /* text segment symbol */
00067   ss_NUM
00068 };
00069 
00070 /* internal program symbol format */
00071 struct sym_sym_t {
00072   char *name;                   /* symbol name */
00073   enum sym_seg_t seg;           /* symbol segment */
00074   int initialized;              /* initialized? (if data segment) */
00075   int pub;                      /* externally visible? */
00076   int local;                    /* compiler local symbol? */
00077   md_addr_t addr;               /* symbol address value */
00078   int size;                     /* bytes to next symbol */
00079 };
00080 
00081 /* symbol database in no particular order */
00082 extern struct sym_sym_t *sym_db;
00083 
00084 /* all symbol sorted by address */
00085 extern int sym_nsyms;
00086 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_syms;
00087 
00088 /* all symbols sorted by name */
00089 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_syms_by_name;
00090 
00091 /* text symbols sorted by address */
00092 extern int sym_ntextsyms;
00093 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_textsyms;
00094 
00095 /* text symbols sorted by name */
00096 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_textsyms_by_name;
00097 
00098 /* data symbols sorted by address */
00099 extern int sym_ndatasyms;
00100 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_datasyms;
00101 
00102 /* data symbols sorted by name */
00103 extern struct sym_sym_t **sym_datasyms_by_name;
00104 
00105 /* load symbols out of FNAME */
00106 void
00107 sym_loadsyms(char *fname,               /* file name containing symbols */
00108              int load_locals);          /* load local symbols */
00109 
00110 /* dump symbol SYM to output stream FD */
00111 void
00112 sym_dumpsym(struct sym_sym_t *sym,      /* symbol to display */
00113             FILE *fd);                  /* output stream */
00114 
00115 /* dump all symbols to output stream FD */
00116 void
00117 sym_dumpsyms(FILE *fd);                 /* output stream */
00118 
00119 /* dump all symbol state to output stream FD */
00120 void
00121 sym_dumpstate(FILE *fd);                /* output stream */
00122 
00123 /* symbol databases available */
00124 enum sym_db_t {
00125   sdb_any,                      /* search all symbols */
00126   sdb_text,                     /* search text symbols */
00127   sdb_data,                     /* search data symbols */
00128   sdb_NUM
00129 };
00130 
00131 /* bind address ADDR to a symbol in symbol database DB, the address must
00132    match exactly if EXACT is non-zero, the index of the symbol in the
00133    requested symbol database is returned in *PINDEX if the pointer is
00134    non-NULL */
00135 struct sym_sym_t *                      /* symbol found, or NULL */
00136 sym_bind_addr(md_addr_t addr,           /* address of symbol to locate */
00137               int *pindex,              /* ptr to index result var */
00138               int exact,                /* require exact address match? */
00139               enum sym_db_t db);        /* symbol database to search */
00140 
00141 /* bind name NAME to a symbol in symbol database DB, the index of the symbol
00142    in the requested symbol database is returned in *PINDEX if the pointer is
00143    non-NULL */
00144 struct sym_sym_t *                              /* symbol found, or NULL */
00145 sym_bind_name(char *name,                       /* symbol name to locate */
00146               int *pindex,                      /* ptr to index result var */
00147               enum sym_db_t db);                /* symbol database to search */
00148 
00149 #ifdef __cplusplus
00150 }
00151 #endif
00152 
00153 #endif /* SYMBOL_H */
